question:
Which among the following winds originate from sub tropical high pressure belt and move towards subpolar
low pressure belt?
explanation:
The westerlies are permanent winds which originate from sub tropical high pressure belt and move towards subpolar
low pressure belt. They prevail between 35° to 60 ° latitudes. They are more intense during winters. They transport warm and moist air toward the pole. The British type of climate or the western European type of climate is produced by the westerly which causes rainfall throughout the year. They are known as roaring forties along 40°S, furious fifties along 50°S and shrieking sixties along 60°S.
